thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: Bitcoin Powers Big Returns for a Pair of ETFs

author: Asjylyn Loder
title: Bitcoin Powers Big Returns for a Pair of ETFs
text:
Bitcoin boosted the returns of two of the top-performing exchange-traded funds last year, signaling that some fund companies arenâ€™t waiting for regulators to approve a U.S. fund devoted exclusively to the cryptocurrency.
Bitcoin is the largest holding of two ETFs from Ark Investment Management, a New York-based investment firm that owns shares in a trust that holds bitcoin. Both funds returned more than 97% since the end of 2016, according to FactSet. The funds each had about 6% of their assets in bitcoin, which soared 1,446%... RELATED VIDEO Bitcoin vs. Regulators: Who Will Win? As bitcoin has emerged from the underground world of nerds and criminals to become a mainstream investment, the risk of hacks and scandals has also blossomed. What's a government to do? The WSJ's Steven Russolillo travels the world (sort of) to see how regulators are responding to the remarkable rise of cryptocurrencies. Video: Sharon Shi and Crystal Tai
